page.title: 10A Twyford Farmer's Day
page.content: {Typical day in August-}very slack time of year between haymaking and harvesting.This farmer farms 50 acres- all grassland. Rise at 7.30a.m.-has breakfast-feeds pigs(48 head)and chickens(26).Cleans out and litters 6 pig pens and collets eggs.Tours fields to count and check 82 sheep and 34 store cattle.Rounds up 2 strayed lambs from neighbouring farm land and stops gaps in hedges.Make hayrack for calves to use during winter months.Midday-stops for dinner and returns to work at 1.00p.m.Spends the afternoon cleaning out covered yards used by cattle during winter. Loads manure into spreader and spreads onto fields.Feeds pigs and collects eggs.Finish work at 5.00p.m.At harvest time or lambing a self-employed farmer may work all daylight hours plus nightwork.
